content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
Similarly, university-level education of the engineers who can create next-generation automated trading systems requires that they have hands-on learning experience in a sufficiently realistic teaching environment.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The identified complex parts of the text are: "university-level education", "automated trading systems", and "sufficiently realistic teaching environment". 

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 5-6 on a 1-10 scale, where 1 is very simple and 10 is very complex. This is because the passage contains technical terms and abstract concepts that may be unfamiliar to non-experts.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
"sufficiently realistic teaching environment"
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"a realistic teaching environment"
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

Similarly, university-level education of the engineers who can create next-generation automated trading systems requires that they have hands-on learning experience in a realistic teaching environment.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

Information loss identified: the original passage emphasized the importance of a "sufficiently realistic" teaching environment, implying a high level of realism, whereas the simplified passage uses a more general term "realistic".

Severity of information loss: Medium to High. The change from "sufficiently realistic" to "realistic" may lead to a slight loss of precision in the original message, but it still conveys the general idea of a high-quality teaching environment.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Medium to High
No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The identified complex parts of the text are: "university-level education", "next-generation automated trading systems", and "hands-on learning experience". 

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 4-5 on a 1-10 scale, where 1 is very simple and 10 is very complex. This is because the passage still contains some technical terms and abstract concepts that may be unfamiliar to non-experts, but they are not as complex as before.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage

Similarly university-level education of the engineers who can create next-generation automated trading systems requires that they have hands-on learning experience in a realistic teaching environment.
